Articles.Content:
Not sure this is actually a question.

I noticed a change in the fuel line workings from 0.19 to 0.20.

In 0.19, I could attach a fuel line to a structual pylon attached to the fuel tank and still get the fuel transfer.

This doesn't work in 0.20 anymore. I have to either attach it to the tank directly or to the engine. It doesn't work anymore with structural stuff.

Was this intentional?

I can't provide pictures at this time, but I think you get the idea.

My problem is that I don't really have the space to get past the engines otherwise, the interplanetary stage is too broad.
Structural pylons never had fuel crossfeed capability. Decouplers in general don't have. Have you maybe used cubic struts before?
I think thats what I meant. Cubic Struts. And Modular Girder Segments.
